org.opensky.libadsb.msgs

Class AltitudeReply

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensky.libadsb.msgs.ModeSReply
      • org.opensky.libadsb.msgs.AltitudeReply
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AltitudeReply
extends ModeSReply
implements java.io.Serializable
    Decoder for Mode S surveillance altitude replies (DF 4)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AltitudeReply

        public AltitudeReply(java.lang.String raw_message)
              throws BadFormatException
        Parameters:
        raw_message - raw altitude reply as hex string
        Throws:
        BadFormatException - if message is not altitude reply or contains wrong values.

    • Method Detail

      • getFlightStatus

        public byte getFlightStatus()
        Indicates alerts, whether SPI is enabled, and if the plane is on ground.
        Returns:
        The 3 bits flight status. The coding is:
        • 0 signifies no alert and no SPI, aircraft is airborne
        • 1 signifies no alert and no SPI, aircraft is on the ground
        • 2 signifies alert, no SPI, aircraft is airborne
        • 3 signifies alert, no SPI, aircraft is on the ground
        • 4 signifies alert and SPI, aircraft is airborne or on the ground
        • 5 signifies no alert and SPI, aircraft is airborne or on the ground
        • 6 reserved
        • 7 not assigned
        See Also:
        hasAlert(), hasSPI(), isOnGround()

      • hasAlert

        public boolean hasAlert()
        Returns:
        whether flight status indicates alert

      • hasSPI

        public boolean hasSPI()
        Returns:
        whether flight status indicates special purpose indicator

      • isOnGround

        public boolean isOnGround()
        Returns:
        whether flight status indicates that aircraft is airborne or on the ground; For flight status >= 4, this flag is unknown

      • getDownlinkRequest

        public byte getDownlinkRequest()
        indicator for downlink requests
        Returns:
        the 5 bits downlink request. The coding is:
        • 0 signifies no downlink request
        • 1 signifies request to send Comm-B message
        • 2 reserved for ACAS
        • 3 reserved for ACAS
        • 4 signifies Comm-B broadcast message 1 available
        • 5 signifies Comm-B broadcast message 2 available
        • 6 reserved for ACAS
        • 7 reserved for ACAS
        • 8-15 not assigned
        • 16-31 see downlink ELM protocol (3.1.2.7.7.1)

      • getUtilityMsg

        public byte getUtilityMsg()
        Returns:
        The 6 bits utility message (see ICAO Annex 10 V4)

      • getInterrogatorIdentifier

        public byte getInterrogatorIdentifier()
        Note that this is not the same identifier as the one contained in all-call replies.
        Returns:
        the 4-bit interrogator identifier subfield of the utility message which reports the identifier of the interrogator that is reserved for multisite communications.

      • getIdentifierDesignator

        public byte getIdentifierDesignator()
        Assigned coding is:
        0 signifies no information
        1 signifies IIS contains Comm-B II code
        2 signifies IIS contains Comm-C II code
        3 signifies IIS contains Comm-D II code
        Returns:
        the 2-bit identifier designator subfield of the utility message which reports the type of reservation made by the interrogator identified in getInterrogatorIdentifier.

      • getAltitudeCode

        public short getAltitudeCode()
        Returns:
        The 13 bits altitude code (see ICAO Annex 10 V4)

      • getAltitude

        public double getAltitude()
        Returns:
        the decoded altitude in meters

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class ModeSReply
